intro: Lotononis foliosa, commonly known as the leafy lotononis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within humid forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
